definition: to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth
parent/one's own (flesh and blood)/relative/related/marriage/bride/close/intimate/in person/first-hand/in favor of/pro-/to kiss/(Internet slang) dear

sentences.english: Mom said you should get married.
Arthur is pressured into an arranged marriage with a visiting princess.
sentences.chinese: 亚瑟王子遭受压力和一位拜访上门的公主成亲。

sentences.english: He once stayed there for quite some time following his friend's wedding.
sentences.chinese: 在他朋友成亲那年，黄药师曾经在那儿住了一段时间。

sentences.english: You should not force her to marry you.
sentences.chinese: 你不该强迫她与你成亲。

sentences.english: You should have told me as soon as you got married.
sentences.chinese: 你该在一成亲的时候就告诉我。

sentences.english: Dong Wenbin suddenly put forward in position now and in her marriage.
sentences.chinese: 董文彬突然提出就在阵地在现在和她成亲。

sentences.english: In order to be right and proper three guns and bonuses, Chen wants to get married.
sentences.chinese: 为了更加的名正言顺，陈三炮想要和花红成亲。

sentences.english: This is to arrange to give the Luo Xiao accustomed meantime marrying of, you take to go to now.
sentences.chinese: 这本就是准备给洛萧成亲时用的，你现在拿去吧。

sentences.english: It is a custom to get married in a mauve dress.
sentences.chinese: 穿紫红色衣服成亲是种风俗。

sentences.english: When the weasel and cat make a marriage, it is a very ill presage.
sentences.chinese: 黄鼠狼和猫成亲，这是一个危险的兆头。

definition: variant of 定親|定亲[ding4 qin1]
(of a child bride) to consummate marriage
ritual kneeling to heaven and earth by bride and groom in a old-fashioned wedding ceremony/same as 拜天地
to reach marriageable age (a girl's fifteenth birthday)
to take a wife/to get married (man)
to send the betrothal gifts/(fig.) to conclude a marriage
